Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
CAN: The student may attempt to draw a plant, but the drawing may be a simple shape that vaguely resembles a plant.
The student might include a sun or some surrounding elements, but these will not be connected to the plant's health or water needs.
CANNOT: The student is unlikely to show the differences between a healthy plant and a wilting plant (may believe there is no difference).
The drawing is unlikely to represent the importance of water for plant health (student may not make a connection between water and plant health).
The student may not show any signs of wilting or dryness in the plant (might not know what wilting looks like or means).
The student might not include any indication of water presence or absence, or misrepresent the effects due to lack of understanding.
